Name: Abusive Sergeant
Description: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn. ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!

Name: Acolyte of Pain
Description: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card. He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.

Name: Amani Berserker
Description: Has +3 Attack while damaged. If an Amani berserker asks 'Joo lookin' at me?!', the correct response is 'Nah, mon'.

Name: Ancient Brewmaster
Description: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand. Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak. But apparently that's a compliment.

Name: Arathi Weaponsmith
Description: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2 weapon. 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

Name: Argent Protector
Description: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Divine Shield. 'I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs. I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to.'

Name: Argent Squire
Description: Divine Shield 'I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos.' - The Argent Dawn Oath

Name: Battle Rage
Description: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character. 'You won't like me when I'm angry.'

Name: Betrayal
Description: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it. Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

Name: Blessing of Wisdom
Description: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card. Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

Name: Blood Imp
Description: Stealth. At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health. Imps are content to hide and viciously taunt everyone nearby.

Name: Bloodsail Raider
Description: Battlecry: Gain Attack equal to the Attack of your weapon. 'I only plunder on days that end in 'y'.'

Name: Call of the Void
Description: Add a random Demon to your hand. 'Marco!'

Name: Circle of Healing
Description: Restore 4 Health to ALL minions. It isn't really a circle.

Name: Cold Blood
Description: Give a minion +2 Attack. Combo: +4 Attack instead. 'I'm cold blooded, check it and see!'

Name: Cone of Cold
Description: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal 1 damage to them. Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

Name: Cruel Taskmaster
Description: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack. 'I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday.' - Cruel Taskmaster

Name: Cult Master
Description: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card. She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

Name: Dark Iron Dwarf
Description: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn. Guardians of Dark Iron Ore. Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

Name: Deadly Shot
Description: Destroy a random enemy minion. Accuracy is not a highly valued trait among the mok'nathal. Deadliness is near the top, though.

Name: Defias Ringleader
Description: Combo: Summon a 2/1 Defias Bandit. He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

Name: Demonfire
Description: Deal 2 damage to a minion. If it's a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead. Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

Name: Dire Wolf Alpha
Description: Adjacent minions have +1 Attack. We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

Name: Dread Corsair
Description: Taunt. Costs (1) less per Attack of your weapon. 'Yarrrr' is a pirate word that means 'Greetings, milord.'

Name: Druid of the Claw
Description: Choose One - Transform into a 4/4 with Charge
column10: or a 4/6 with Taunt. Cat or Bear? Cat or Bear?! I just cannot CHOOSE!

Name: Dust Devil
Description: Windfury. Overload: (2) Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

Name: Earth Shock
Description: Silence a minion, then deal 1 damage to it. Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be 'Azeroth Shock'?

Name: Earthen Ring Farseer
Description: Battlecry: Restore 3 Health. He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

Name: Eviscerate
Description: Deal 2 damage. Combo: Deal 4 damage instead. There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent: It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.

Name: Explosive Trap
Description: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal 2 damage to all enemies. It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

Name: Eye for an Eye
Description: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero. Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

Name: Faerie Dragon
Description: Can't be targeted by Spells or Hero Powers. Adorable. Immune to Magic. Doesn't pee on the rug. The perfect pet!

Name: Fen Creeper
Description: Taunt He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast. Boom, New Name!

Name: Flame Imp
Description: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to your hero. Imps like being on fire. They just do.

Name: Flesheating Ghoul
Description: Whenever a minion dies, gain +1 Attack. 'Flesheating' is an unfair name. It's just that there's not really much else for him to eat.

Name: Forked Lightning
Description: Deal 2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2) If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

Name: Freezing Trap
Description: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand and it costs (2) more. 'Dang, that's cold.' - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

Name: Frost Elemental
Description: Battlecry: Freeze a character. When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

Name: Harvest Golem
Description: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/1 Damaged Golem. 'Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down.'

Name: Ice Barrier
Description: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor. This is Rank 1. Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

Name: Inner Fire
Description: Change a minion's Attack to be equal to its Health. Good idea: Buffing your minions. Bad idea: Starting a conversation in the Barrens.

Name: Inner Rage
Description: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack. They're only smiling on the outside.

Name: Ironbeak Owl
Description: Battlecry: Silence a minion. Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.

Name: Jungle Panther
Description: Stealth Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.

Name: Leper Gnome
Description: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero. He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

Name: Lightning Bolt
Description: Deal 3 damage. Overload: (1) Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

Name: Lightspawn
Description: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health. Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

Name: Loot Hoarder
Description: Deathrattle: Draw a card. Always roll need.

Name: Mad Bomber
Description: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters. He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

Name: Mana Wyrm
Description: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack. These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

Name: Mark of Nature
Description: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack
column10: or +4 Health and Taunt. Druids call it the 'Mark of Nature.' Everyone else calls it 'needing a bath.'

Name: Mirror Entity
Description: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it. 'You go first.' - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

Name: Mogu'shan Warden
Description: Taunt All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King. BOOOORRRINNG!

Name: Naturalize
Description: Destroy a minion. Your opponent draws 2 cards. Another one bites the dust.

Name: Noble Sacrifice
Description: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target. We will always remember you, 'Defender!'

Name: Pilfer
Description: Add a random card to your hand (from your opponent's class). The class is always greener on the other side of the board.

Name: Power of the Wild
Description: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1
column10: or Summon a 3/2 Panther. Never look a panther in the eye. Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'? Well, it's one of those.

Name: Priestess of Elune
Description: Battlecry: Restore 4 Health to your hero. If she threatens to 'moon' you, it's not what you think.

Name: Raging Worgen
Description: Has +1 Attack and Windfury while damaged. If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

Name: Rampage
Description: Give a damaged minion +3/+3. Minion get ANGRY. Minion SMASH!

Name: Redemption
Description: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to life with 1 Health. I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time. It’s a mystery!

Name: Repentance
Description: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1. Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

Name: Scarlet Crusader
Description: Divine Shield Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

Name: Scavenging Hyena
Description: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1. Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything. Even Brussels sprouts.

Name: Sense Demons
Description: Draw 2 Demons from your deck. Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

Name: Shadowstep
Description: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less. Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance. Crowds love it.

Name: Shieldbearer
Description: Taunt Have you seen the size of the shields in this game?? This is no easy job.

Name: Silence
Description: Silence a minion. Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

Name: Silver Hand Knight
Description: Battlecry: Summon a 2/2 Squire. It's good to be a knight. Less so to be one's squire.

Name: Silvermoon Guardian
Description: Divine Shield The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

Name: Slam
Description: Deal 2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card. 'Dun da dun, dun da dun': if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

Name: Snipe
Description: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal 4 damage to it. A great sniper hits the spot. Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

Name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
Description: Your spells cost (1) less. Apprentices are great for bossing around. 'Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee! Make that a mana coffee!'

Name: Soul of the Forest
Description: Give your minions 'Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant.' 'Reforestation' is suddenly a terrifying word.

Name: Southsea Deckhand
Description: Has Charge while you have a weapon equipped. Pirates are into this new fad called 'Planking'.

Name: Spellbreaker
Description: Battlecry: Silence a minion. Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders. The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

Name: Spiteful Smith
Description: Your weapon has +2 Attack while this is damaged. She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

Name: Stormforged Axe
Description: Overload: (1) Yo, that's a nice axe.

Name: Stranglethorn Tiger
Description: Stealth The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

Name: Summoning Portal
Description: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1). NOT LESS THAN 1! Don't get any ideas!

Name: Tauren Warrior
Description: Taunt.

Name: Temple Enforcer
Description: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +3 Health. He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

Name: Thoughtsteal
Description: Copy 2 cards from your opponent's deck and put them into your hand. 'What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc? Nothing!' - Tauren joke

Name: Thrallmar Farseer
Description: Windfury He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

Name: Tome of Intellect
Description: Add a random Mage spell to your hand. Just a compilation of napkins of intellect.

Name: Unbound Elemental
Description: Whenever you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1. Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

Name: Unleash the Hounds
Description: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge. You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

Name: Venture Co. Mercenary
Description: Your minions cost (3) more. No Job is too big. No fee is too big.

Name: Windfury Harpy
Description: Windfury Harpies are not pleasant sounding. That's the nicest I can put it.

Name: Wisp
Description: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode. But why?

Name: Worgen Infiltrator
Description: Stealth If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, 'No! Bad boy!'

Name: Wrath
Description: Choose One - Deal 3 damage to a minion
column10: or 1 damage and draw a card. The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

Name: Young Dragonhawk
Description: Windfury They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.

Name: Youthful Brewmaster
Description: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand. His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews. Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

Name: Abomination
Description: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to ALL characters. Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

Name: Alarm-o-Bot
Description: At the start of your turn, swap this minion with a random one in your hand. WARNING. WARNING. WARNING.

Name: Aldor Peacekeeper
Description: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1. The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

Name: Ancestral Spirit
Description: Give a minion 'Deathrattle: Resummon this minion.' It was just a flesh wound.

Name: Ancient Mage
Description: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Spell Damage +1. Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

Name: Ancient Watcher
Description: Can't attack. Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

Name: Angry Chicken
Description: Has +5 Attack while damaged. There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

Name: Arcane Golem
Description: Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal. Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

Name: Argent Commander
Description: Charge

Name: Armorsmith
Description: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor. She accepts guild funds for repairs!

Name: Auchenai Soulpriest
Description: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead. The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

Name: Bite
Description: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn. Gain 4 Armor. Chew your food!

Name: Blade Flurry
Description: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemy minions. 'Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast. It's a lot more complicated than that.' - Shan, Rogue Trainer

Name: Blessed Champion
Description: Double a minion's Attack. This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

Name: Blizzard
Description: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them. This spell can be very Entertaining.

Name: Bloodsail Corsair
Description: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon. Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers. It's called the 'Pirate's Code'.

Name: Coldlight Seer
Description: Battlecry: Give your other Murlocs +2 Health. The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths. So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

Name: Commanding Shout
Description: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card. 'Shout! Shout! Let it all out!' - Advice to warriors-in-training

Name: Counterspell
Description: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it. What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't? The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

Name: Crazed Alchemist
Description: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion. 'You'll love my new recipe!' he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.

Name: Defender of Argus
Description: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +1/+1 and Taunt. You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending. But it does.

Name: Demolisher
Description: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy. Laying siege isn't fun for anyone. It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

Name: Divine Favor
Description: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent. This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

Name: Doomguard
Description: Charge. Battlecry: Discard two random cards. Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

Name: Eaglehorn Bow
Description: Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability. First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

Name: Emperor Cobra
Description: Poisonous The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray. And plate armor.

Name: Equality
Description: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1. We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

Name: Ethereal Arcanist
Description: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2. The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

Name: Explosive Shot
Description: Deal 5 damage to a minion and 2 damage to adjacent ones. Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot. Then duck.

Name: Felguard
Description: Taunt. Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals. Yes, he'll fight for you. BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

Name: Feral Spirit
Description: Summon two 2/3 Spirit Wolves with Taunt. Overload: (2) Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

Name: Flare
Description: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card. Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

Name: Frothing Berserker
Description: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack. He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

Name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
Description: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card. He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.

Name: Headcrack
Description: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn. When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

Name: Holy Fire
Description: Deal 5 damage. Restore 5 Health to your hero. Often followed by Holy Smokes!

Name: Holy Wrath
Description: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its cost. C'mon Molten Giant!!

Name: Imp Master
Description: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to this minion and summon a 1/1 Imp. She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

Name: Injured Blademaster
Description: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to HIMSELF. He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.

Name: Keeper of the Grove
Description: Choose One - Deal 2 damage
column10: or Silence a minion. These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

Name: Kirin Tor Mage
Description: Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0). The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran. How do you make a Dalaran float? Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

Name: Knife Juggler
Description: After you summon a minion, deal 1 damage to a random enemy. Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers. They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

Name: Lava Burst
Description: Deal 5 damage. Overload: (2) It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

Name: Lightning Storm
Description: Deal 2-3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2) An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

Name: Lightwarden
Description: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack. She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

Name: Lightwell
Description: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character. It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

Name: Mana Addict
Description: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn. She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

Name: Mana Tide Totem
Description: At the end of your turn, draw a card. It is said that some shaman can say 'Floatin' totem' 10 times, fast.

Name: Mana Wraith
Description: ALL minions cost (1) more. They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. 'Mmmmmm,' they say.

Name: Mass Dispel
Description: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card. It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

Name: Master of Disguise
Description: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth until your next turn. She's actually a male tauren. People don't call him 'Master of Disguise' for nothing.

Name: Master Swordsmith
Description: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack. He's currently trying to craft a 'flail-axe', but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.

Name: Mind Control Tech
Description: Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one at random. Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

Name: Misdirection
Description: Secret: When a character attacks your hero, instead he attacks another random character. Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

Name: Mortal Strike
Description: Deal 4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal 6 instead. 'If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike.' - The Warrior Code, Line 6

Name: Murloc Tidecaller
Description: Whenever you summon a Murloc, gain +1 Attack. This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

Name: Nourish
Description: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals
column10: or Draw 3 cards. Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

Name: Perdition's Blade
Description: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage. Combo: Deal 2 instead. Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

Name: Pint-Sized Summoner
Description: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less. She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

Name: Questing Adventurer
Description: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1. 'Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?'

Name: Ravenholdt Assassin
Description: Stealth Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold. He'll take care of the rest.

Name: Savagery
Description: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion. It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

Name: Savannah Highmane
Description: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas. In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

Name: Secretkeeper
Description: Whenever a Secret is played, gain +1/+1. She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.

Name: Shadow Madness
Description: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn. You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

Name: Shadowflame
Description: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions. Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

Name: SI:7 Agent
Description: Combo: Deal 2 damage. The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities. Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

Name: Siphon Soul
Description: Destroy a minion. Restore 3 Health to your hero. You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul. You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

Name: Stampeding Kodo
Description: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack. This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

Name: Starfall
Description: Choose One - Deal 5 damage to a minion
column10: or 2 damage to all enemy minions. Is the sky falling? Yes. Yes it is.

Name: Sunfury Protector
Description: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt. She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

Name: Sunwalker
Description: Taunt. Divine Shield She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun. It's just a name. Don’t worry!

Name: Twilight Drake
Description: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand. Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy. And Tacos.

Name: Upgrade!
Description: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon. Easily worth 50 DKP.

Name: Vaporize
Description: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it. Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card. We may never know the truth.

Name: Violet Teacher
Description: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice. If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig. And then you get your name on the board.

Name: Void Terror
Description: Battlecry: Destroy the minions on either side of this minion and gain their Attack and Health. If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

Name: Wild Pyromancer
Description: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions. BOOM BABY BOOM! BAD IS GOOD! DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

Name: Young Priestess
Description: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health. She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

Name: Ancient of Lore
Description: Choose One - Draw a card
column10: or Restore 5 Health. Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

Name: Ancient of War
Description: Choose One - +5 Attack
column10: or +5 Health and Taunt. Young Night Elves love to play 'Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?' You lose if you get crushed to death.

Name: Avenging Wrath
Description: Deal 8 damage randomly split among all enemies. Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

Name: Bane of Doom
Description: Deal 2 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon. My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

Name: Bestial Wrath
Description: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn. The seething wrath is just beneath the surface. Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

Name: Big Game Hunter
Description: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 7 or more. Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him. Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.

Name: Blood Knight
Description: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost. The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

Name: Brawl
Description: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly) Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

Name: Cabal Shadow Priest
Description: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack. You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....

Name: Doomhammer
Description: Windfury, Overload: (2) Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall. His name is a total coincidence.

Name: Doomsayer
Description: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions. He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

Name: Earth Elemental
Description: Taunt

Name: Faceless Manipulator
Description: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it. The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

Name: Far Sight
Description: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less. Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.

Name: Force of Nature
Description: Summon three 2/2 Treants. 'I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!' - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

Name: Gladiator's Longbow
Description: Your hero is Immune while attacking. The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

Name: Gorehowl
Description: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability. Grommash Hellscream's famous axe. Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession. Quite the mystery!

Name: Hungry Crab
Description: Battlecry: Destroy a Murloc and gain +2/+2. Murloc. It's what's for dinner.

Name: Icicle
Description: Deal 2 damage to a minion. If it's Frozen, draw a card. This may appear weak at frost glance, but it's actually a very ice spell.

Name: Kidnapper
Description: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand. He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

Name: Lay on Hands
Description: Restore 8 Health. Draw 3 cards. A grammatically awkward life saver.

Name: Mindgames
Description: Put a copy of a random minion from your opponent's deck into the battlefield. Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

Name: Mountain Giant
Description: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand. His mother said that he was just big boned.

Name: Murloc Warleader
Description: Your other Murlocs have +2 Attack. Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound? Nope! Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

Name: Patient Assassin
Description: Stealth

Name: Pit Lord
Description: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to your hero. Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

Name: Preparation
Description: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less. 'Be Prepared' - Rogue Motto

Name: Pyroblast
Description: Deal 10 damage. Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

Name: Sea Giant
Description: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield. See? Giant.

Name: Shadowform
Description: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage'. If already in Shadowform: 3 damage. If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?

Name: Shield Slam
Description: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have. 'What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?' - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

Name: Snake Trap
Description: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes. Why did it have to be snakes?

Name: Southsea Captain
Description: Your other Pirates have +1/+1. When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat. He has hat envy.

Name: Spellbender
Description: Secret: When an enemy casts a spell on a minion, summon a 1/3 as the new target. While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild. It just feels meaner. And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

Name: Sword of Justice
Description: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability. I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

Name: Twisting Nether
Description: Destroy all minions. The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

Name: Al'Akir the Windlord
Description: Windfury, Charge, Divine Shield, Taunt He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords. And the other three don't let him forget it.

Name: Alexstrasza
Description: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15. Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone. Except Deathwing. And Malygos. And Nekros.

Name: Archmage Antonidas
Description: Whenever you cast a spell, put a 'Fireball' spell into your hand. Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor. This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

Name: Baron Geddon
Description: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters. Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

Name: Bloodmage Thalnos
Description: Spell Damage +1. Deathrattle: Draw a card. He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!

Name: Cairne Bloodhoof
Description: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/5 Baine Bloodhoof. Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck. It's pretty insensitive.

Name: Captain Greenskin
Description: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1/+1. He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

Name: Cenarius
Description: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2
column10: or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt. Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

Name: Deathwing
Description: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand. Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated. Daddy issues?

Name: Edwin VanCleef
Description: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each other card you've played this turn. He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

Name: Grommash Hellscream
Description: Charge

Name: Gruul
Description: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 . He's Gruul 'the Dragonkiller'. He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…

Name: Harrison Jones
Description: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability. “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

Name: Hogger
Description: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt. Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

Name: Illidan Stormrage
Description: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of Azzinoth. Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years. Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

Name: King Krush
Description: Charge The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

Name: King Mukla
Description: Battlecry: Give your opponent 2 Bananas. King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

Name: Leeroy Jenkins
Description: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent. At least he has Angry Chicken.

Name: Lord Jaraxxus
Description: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus. 'TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!'

Name: Lorewalker Cho
Description: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player's hand. Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

Name: Malygos
Description: Spell Damage +5 Malygos hates it when mortals use magic. He gets so mad!

Name: Millhouse Manastorm
Description: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (0) next turn. 'I'm gonna light you up, sweetcheeks!'

Name: Nat Pagle
Description: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card. Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman! He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

Name: Nozdormu
Description: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns. Time to write some flavor text.

Name: Onyxia
Description: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full. Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor. You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

Name: Prophet Velen
Description: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power. He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

Name: The Beast
Description: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent. He lives in Blackrock Mountain. He eats Gnomes. That's pretty much it.

Name: The Black Knight
Description: Battlecry: Destroy an enemy minion with Taunt. He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament. We can pretty much mark that a failure.

Name: Tinkmaster Overspark
Description: Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel. Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.
